title: Impossibly Easy Cheeseburger Pie Recipe
description: Enjoy this savory dinner pie with juicy ground beef, biscuit mix, and Cheddar cheese. It tastes just like a cheeseburger but you eat it with a fork!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Everyday Cooking Impossibly Easy Cheeseburger Pie 4.5 (252) 203 Reviews 63 Photos This easy cheeseburger pie with lean ground beef, biscuit mix, onions, and Cheddar cheese bakes in the oven in just 25 minutes. It's just like a cheeseburger but eaten with a fork! Submitted by Bisquick Updated on November 13, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 63 63 63 63 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 35 mins Total Time: 50 mins Servings: 6 Yield: 1 9-inch pie Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings cooking spray 1 pound lean (at least 80%) ground beef 1 large onion, chopped 1 cup milk ¬Ω cup Original Bisquick¬Æ mix 2 large eggs ¬Ω teaspoon salt 1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese Directions Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Spray 9-inch glass pie pan with cooking spray. Cook beef and onion in a nonstick skillet over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until beef is browned and crumbly, 8 to 10 minutes. Meanwhile, whisk milk, Bisquick, and eggs together in a small bowl. Drain beef and onion mixture; transfer to the prepared pie pan. Stir in salt, sprinkle with Cheddar, and pour Bisquick mixture over top. Bake in the preheated oven until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean, about 25 minutes. Recipe Tip Bake for 30 to 35 minutes if you are baking at a high altitude (3500 to 6500 ft). I Made It Print 671 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 334 Calories 21g Fat 11g Carbs 25g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 6 Calories 334 % Daily Value * Total Fat 21g 27% Saturated Fat 10g 50% Cholesterol 142mg 47% Sodium 550mg 24% Total Carbohydrate 11g 4% Dietary Fiber 1g 2% Total Sugars 3g Protein 25g 50% Vitamin C 2mg 2% Calcium 250mg 19% Iron 2mg 12% Potassium 337mg 7% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Impossibly Easy Cheeseburger Pie 01 of 63 Photo by¬† Allrecipes Member 02 of 63 Photo by¬† TxCin2 04/12/2025 This is easy and makes a nice meal that's something a little different. This can best be described as quiche-like. It's got the texture of a breakfast casserole. I've been making this for over 25 years and it's a classic. They no longer put the recipe on the box, so it's great to find it posted here where I can access it again readily. I used rehydrated dried minced onion and a little onion powder as a shortcut to chopping my own fresh onion. I eyeballed the amount until it looked like a decent ratio of beef to onion. Do use a really good cheddar cheese for this as it adds much needed flavor. This is pretty basic, so it can be a little bland, but add what you'd like and make it your own. A pinch of cayenne would be nice in this. This made a nice dinner with little effort and used items I always have on hand. It isn't fancy and it isn't impressive, but it's fed generations, and it's still going. 03 of 63 Photo by¬† LJRosie39 02/12/2025 OK with tweaks Needs more flavor Might try again I‚Äôm glad I made it and I‚Äôm glad I read the reviews and suggestions. Even after adding seasoning salt, drained Rotel, and garlic powder to the meat, it was still a little bit bland. I topped it with chopped dill pickles, shredded lettuce, Rotel tomatoes (reserved from the meat additions) and Thousand Island dressing. It needs a little bit of a mustard bite to be more like a cheeseburger. Next time I will add a mustard sauce to the toppings and cook it for 30 minutes. It was good warmed up the next day for lunch too. 04 of 63 Photo by¬† RowdyApple7443 05/10/2024 OK with tweaks Needs more flavor Might try again Omg I tell you what!!!! First I don‚Äôt eat eggs I used a teaspoon baking powder and 2 teaspoon mayonnaise for the egg substitute then also added roasted green pepper for more color and flavor and sorta layered it thin layer dough then the meat save a half cup for topping and then add cheese then 3 quarter of the dough and the saved meat and the rest of the dough on top I baked for 43 minutes mine is thicker and bc of the egg substitute you need a few minutes longer in the oven it came out I added cheese and melted that on top and served and it was so delicious ü§§ its definitely a meal you‚Äôll want again and again and maybe switch it up to your families liking ü´∂ 05 of 63 Photo by¬† Lisa Taravella 04/05/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Family favorite The only thing I did different was add some garlic powder, paprika, and Jalape√±os. It‚Äôs was way and quick. Yummy!!!! 06 of 63 Photo by¬† StaceyWlz 08/15/2021 07 of 63 Photo by¬† bwest789 01/19/2021 Very yummy! Does anyone know if it freezes ok? I live alone and will be eating this all week lol. 08 of 63 Photo by¬† bwest789 01/19/2021 Very yummy! Does anyone know if it freezes ok? I live alone and will be eating this all week lol. 09 of 63 Photo by¬† David Auld 07/10/2020 This is a favorite dish of mine. I only use half of an onion to keep the flavor center around the beef 10 of 63 Photo by¬† catherine lynn 06/27/2020 Easy, delicious, convenient, most of us almost always have these simple ingredients on hand! I added bread and butter pickles for some sweetness to contrast the other flavors. Husband and kids loved it! Will be making this again, maybe will add bacon next time. 1 2 3 4 5 Next You‚Äôll Also Love Spooky Calzone Snake 90 Ratings Argentinian Beef Empanadas 26 Ratings Impossible Cheeseburger Pie 22 Ratings Reuben Crescent Bake 81 Ratings Dad's Leftover Turkey Pot Pie 1,560 Ratings Meat Pie, Southern Version 40 Ratings Classic Shepherd's Pie 133 Ratings Black-Eyed Pea Pie 15 Ratings Mushroom Pie 207 Ratings Burek 48 Ratings Tourtiere (French Canadian Meat Pie) 177 Ratings Grands! name: Bisquick
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Spray 9-inch glass pie pan with cooking spray.;Cook beef and onion in a nonstick skillet over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until beef is browned and crumbly, 8 to 10 minutes.;Meanwhile, whisk milk, Bisquick, and eggs together in a small bowl.;Drain beef and onion mixture; transfer to the prepared pie pan. Stir in salt, sprinkle with Cheddar, and pour Bisquick mixture over top.;Bake in the preheated oven until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean, about 25 minutes.
